# Copilot Instructions for Hub of Epstein Files Directory

## Project Overview
This repository serves as a comprehensive directory and organizational hub for Epstein-related files and documentation. It includes a glossary, table of contents, character directory, and search functionality through AI agents.

## Primary Goals
- Maintain an organized, searchable directory structure
- Provide clear navigation through glossary and table of contents
- Ensure accurate character/entity information
- Support AI agent functionality for information retrieval

## Code Style and Standards

### Documentation
- Use clear, descriptive headings with proper markdown formatting
- Maintain consistent formatting across all documentation files
- Use bullet points for lists and tables for structured data
- Include proper cross-references between related documents

### File Organization
- Keep directory structure flat and intuitive
- Use descriptive file names with lowercase and hyphens (e.g., `character-directory.md`)
- Group related content logically
- Maintain a clear table of contents

### Content Guidelines
- Ensure factual accuracy and cite sources when possible
- Use neutral, objective language
- Maintain consistency in terminology across documents
- Include dates and context for time-sensitive information

## Acceptable Changes

### Encouraged Tasks
- Adding new entries to glossary or character directory
- Improving documentation clarity and organization
- Fixing typos, formatting issues, or broken links
- Enhancing navigation and search functionality
- Adding new structured directories or indices
- Improving README with better descriptions

### Discouraged Changes
- Removing existing verified information without justification
- Making subjective or biased editorial changes
- Reorganizing the entire structure without discussion
- Adding unverified or speculative content

## Testing and Validation
- Verify all markdown files render correctly
- Check that all internal links work properly
- Ensure table of contents stays in sync with actual files
- Validate that new entries follow existing formatting patterns

## Pull Request Guidelines
- Provide clear descriptions of what was added or changed
- Explain the rationale for organizational changes
- Include references or sources for new information
- Keep changes focused and atomic (one logical change per PR)

## Special Considerations
- This is primarily a documentation repository
- Focus on organization, clarity, and accessibility
- Maintain a professional, factual tone
- Respect the sensitive nature of the subject matter
